MSG.ShortText: Context pointer of global instance not yet initialized
MSG.Description: Access to the global context of the runtime environment is not yet possible, because the initialization has not yet taken place.

PAM authentication (Pluggable Authentication Module) failed. The specified user $USERID$ could not be identified through his/her password. The exact meaning of the PAM specific error text $ERRORTEXT$ can be determined in the PAM documentation of the operating system manufacturer.

PAM service $DESCRIPTION$ authentication failed. The specified user $USERID$ could not be identified through his/her password. The exact meaning of the PAM specific error text $ERRORTEXT$ can be determined in the PAM documentation of the operating system manufacturer.
The 'pam_start' command for the PAM service $DESCRIPTION$ for the user $USERID$ failed and registered the PAM internal error $ERRORTEXT$.
The 'pam_acct_mgmt' function of the PAM service registers $ERRORTEXT$ for the user $USERID$. This suggests a block of the relevant account, since the account was already validated.
The 'pam_acct_mgmt' function of the PAM service $DESCRIPTION$ registers $ERRORTEXT$ for the user $USERID$. This suggests a block of the relevant account, since the account was already validated.
Loading the dynamic PAM DLL failed. This means that authentication of user $USERID$ is not possible and thus generating databases over the DBMGUI is not possible.

Each program is activated with a composition of pre-defined environment variables. Since these variables have an effect on the program sequence, they are released in alphabetical order sorted as details of this message.

MSG.ShortText: Creating thread $DESCRIPTION$ with ID $INDEX$ results in $RTE_ERRTEXT$
MSG.Description: A new thread with the description $DESCRIPTION$ and the ID $INDEX$ should be generated. The result $RTE_ERRTEXT$ was returned. The internal error code was $RTE_ERRID$.
